intro: Galium volhynicum, commonly known as Volhynian bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain seeds dispersed by wind or animals. Galium volhynicum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
